sentences.en: Among them a driver is quarrelsome cry: " Did you become blind? "
sentences.cn: 其中一位司机怒气冲冲大叫: “ 你瞎了 吗 ? ”

sentences.en: Are Mr and Mrs Smith always as quarrelsome as they've been this evening?
sentences.cn: 史密斯夫妇是不是经常象今天晚上那样爱吵架?

sentences.en: Balboa had a reputation as a fierce and quarrelsome young man.
sentences.cn: 巴尔博亚是一位以勇猛和喜欢争吵闻名的年轻人.

sentences.en: Benedict had been a wild boy and a quarrelsome young man.
sentences.cn: 贝内迪克特小时候野性难驯，年轻时又爱与人争吵。

sentences.en: He became quarrelsome after drinking too much.
sentences.cn: 他喝多了就爱找人吵架。

sentences.en: He gets quarrelsome in his cups.
He tends to get quarrelsome when he is drunk.
sentences.cn: 他喝醉后就容易与人争吵.

sentences.en: His brothers were greedy and quarrelsome.
sentences.cn: 他的弟兄们贪婪且喜欢争吵.

sentences.en: I was afraid he might be quarrelsome and get himself into more trouble.
sentences.cn: 我怕的是他常常跟别人吵嘴,弄得他自己处于难堪的地位.

sentences.en: So is a quarrelsome person for kindling strife.
The boy is quarrelsome and ready to fight at the drop of a hat.
sentences.cn: 这个男孩爱吵嘴,动不动就打架.

sentences.en: They are quarrelsome, primitive, demanding and messy.
sentences.cn: 他们好吵架, 头脑简单, 要求苛刻,而且肮脏不堪.

sentences.en: We are not either fidgety or quarrelsome now.
sentences.cn: 我们现在既不好寻事,也不爱争吵.
小华是个爱吵架的女孩子.

words.tran_cn: 吵架；反目；怨言；争吵的原因；方头凿
争吵的人；喜欢埋怨的人

trans.tran_en: someone who is quarrelsome quarrels a lot with people
